title: Los Angeles Rams should target free agent tight end Martellus Bennett
text:
Los Angeles Rams should target free agent tight end Martellus Bennett Los Angeles Rams should target free agent tight end Martellus Bennett By Bryan Kalbrosky 15 hours ago 161 shares By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 15 hours ago 
Free agent tight end Martellus Bennett was among the top receiving and pass blocking players at his position with the New England Patriots. 
Rotoworld.com lists Bennett as the best free agent tight end in the NFL. Could he be a good fit for the Los Angeles Rams, who are looking to improve on a historically bad offensive season in 2016? I think the LA Rams should see how much cash it takes to draw Martellus Bennett away from Foxboro. He would be great for Goff. So versatile. 
— Peter Forsee (@Pete4C) February 15, 2017 
Here’s what football analyst Elliot Harrison said about the Super Bowl champion ( via NFL.com ): 
“A lot of people think the Patriots are not going to bring him back … I don’t think New England wants to get in a bidding war at the tight end position, especially with Rob Gronkowski due to be back. Martellus Bennett could be a target for the Rams.” 
Lance Kendricks did not have much success with Los Angeles last season. Yesterday, we wrote about why the Rams may cut their former starter. We also mentioned likely another cap casualty: Eugene Sims. 
It’s worth noting that Bennett has had some serious beef with Sims in the past, so it would be poetic justice if that’s how the Rams made room for Bennett. Related: Will the Rams cut Lance Kendricks, Eugene Sims or Greg Robinson? 
If both were cut, the Rams would save $6.75 million in cap space for free agency. 
Here’s what Bennett said about his upcoming free agency and his desire to get paid ( via Boston Globe ): 
“You want to make as much money as you can while you’re doing it because this game is not guaranteed, so every guy needs to get paid and every guy probably feels like they should get paid more and I would agree with them.” 
Other players that the Rams could cut to make room for Bennett include Alec Ogletree (which would save $8.37 million), Robert Quinn ($5.21M), Rodger Saffold ($4.32M), William Hayes ($2.5M) and Tim Barnes ($2.6M). 
While these all feel less likely than Kendricks and Sims, even one or two of these moves would free up significant cap space if the Rams do not look to bring back Kenny Britt or Trumaine Johnson. Related: Report: Rams likely to move on from WR Kenny Britt 
Recent reports indicate that Los Angeles is not looking to re-sign Britt in the offseason despite his increased productivity last season. 
Bennett would offer a dynamic, impressive athletic option on offense for Goff — which is something that the Rams did not have last season. 
Other players mentioned by Harrison who could go to Los Angeles in free agency include DeSean Jackson and Alshon Jeffery. D-Jax:
